ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned a lot about dramaturgy theory and the questions/work that goes into the work. I also learned a good deal about the working of theater companies around the country.
This course changed how I approach theater and helped me build confidence in the skils of dramturgy
All about dramaturgy and dramaturgical practice, from multiple schools of thought and from multiple angles, from new play dramaturgy, to production dramaturgy, to everything in between.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course was very poorly organized in that the syllabus was never finalize and each week we were fumbling for how to prepare and what to do in the class. When we were told how to prepare for class I feel it went welldiscussions were fruitful and we received a lot of information about the industry and practical skills in the craft toward the end.

I think the course would benefit from having more than one meeting a week, since a lot of the merit in the course came from group discussions of materials. I think the projects were all very engaging and useful, but that they should be spread out a bit more throughout the semester.

Wonderful set of readings that allowed me to have a deep engagement with the history and theory of dramaturgy, illuminating class discussions that kept me thinking every week, and engaging and fun assignments that allowed me to put teachings into practice on a real play I'm working on.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Perhaps with a different professor, because the class is valuable/needed in the TAPS department (and perhaps in general)
Absolutely! Dramaturgy is one of the most useful skillsets for anyone in theater, and this class is a great place to grow.
100% if Otis Ramsey-Zoe is teaching it! Intro Dramaturgy with him is a legendary experience.
